name: rgb()
content:
Using RGBA values, creates colors for using in the background, shapes, lines and points.

Explore the 256^3 possible colors you can choose from using three numeric parameters.

Note that if only one parameter is provided to rgb(), it will be interpreted as a grayscale value. Add a second parameter, and it will be used for alpha transparency for grayscale. When three parameters are specified, they are interpreted as RGB values. Adding a fourth parameter applies alpha transparency to the RGB color.

examples.name: Flag of France
examples.description: You can look up official RGB values for most country flags on Wikipedia.

palette_params.name: r
palette_params.description: The amount of red (0-255) in the color, or if the only parameter a grayscale value.

palette_params.name: g
palette_params.description: The amount of green (0-255) in the color, or if the last parameter the alpha transparency for grayscale

palette_params.name: b
palette_params.description: The amount of blue (0-255) in the color.

palette_params.name: a
palette_params.description: The alpha transparency, a number between 0 (fully transparent) and 1(fully opaque), of the color. Default is 1.

return_value: Returns a color. Usually used as a parameter to background(), fill(), or stroke().
short_description: Using RGBA values, creates colors for using in the background, shapes, lines and points.
tips: - If any of the RGBA values is out of range (0-255), then the value is rounded into range. For example, 300 becomes 255 and -100 becomes 0.
